tweets.text: @CFOESFRS @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @outdoorswimming @ashisnemo ? I know we spoke to them as the consultation was ongoing. Very thoughtful points raised.  I think we need about 1200 designated sites to make a long-lasting diff (allow for travel time ect).

I am not sure what the outcome of this one was ...but with the increase in Open water swimming it would be good to see more designated as safe bathing areas ‚Å¶@DefraGovUK‚Å© ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© and less pollution in our waterways ‚Å¶@outdoorswimming‚Å© https://t.co/inuekJ59xu

Devastating new critique of @EnvAgency by @SalmonTroutCons: ‚ÄúAll monitored waters in England are polluted with toxic & persistent chemicals, including insecticides and herbicides. Millions of hours of untreated sewage flows are still entering our rivers‚Äù
https://t.co/89OXkhNSJV

The last time the toxic fumes were this bad the @EnvAgency "forgot" to switch the monitoring equipment on. This time the ics email has stopped working. @EnvAgency Too many coincidences, @BorisJohnson @AaronBell4NUL What the hell is going on at @EnvAgency!
